content.title: Histologic Classification of FMD
content.description: Histopathologic classification of fibromuscular dysplasia by arterial wall layer involvement

key_concepts.details: Most common type (60-70%); alternating areas of fibromuscular ridges and thinning; classic 'string of beads' appearance
Less common (5%); circumferential intimal collagen deposits; appears as smooth focal stenosis
Rare; collagen proliferation in adventitia extending to periarterial tissue
Collagen deposition in outer media; may have beaded appearance

content.clinical_significance: Histologic type rarely changes management; imaging classification now preferred
